DataElement.preferredName: Same Donor All Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the same donor was used for all of the hematopoietic stem cell transplantations.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Same Donor All Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_The replacement of tissue with tissue from the person's own body or from another person.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree. :Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Property.preferredDefinition: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.

Concepts.definition: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
